wikipedia_page.main: Nigel Patrick Robertson (born 13 August 1962) is a successful entrepreneur and businessman, best known as the founder of FreePages plc (later renamed Scoot.com). Nigel was included in the 2005 Sunday Times Rich List and Monaco's Rich List 2007.

response: *Nigel Robertson (born 1962), entrepreneur, founder of FreePages plc

The origins of Scoot began in March 1993 when businessman Nigel Robertson bought the freephone number 0800 192 192 from British Telecommunications for an estimated value of just £100. Robertson had spotted the potential of acquiring a freephone number similar to BT's own directory enquiries number of 192. BT spent three years trying to recover the number in legal battles but were finally forced to admit defeat in May 1996.
Robertson, along with his brother Nigel Robertson the founder of FreePages, was educated at Canford School, Dorset.
